body:
That would be optimal, and in general I really like the idea of capturing the stack trace of transform application and using it in all error messages. We already do this in PAssert, but it can be applied much more widely - e.g. errors during coder inference, validation errors, some runtime errors etc.

I suspect that implementing that can have some unexpected stumbling blocks, so I would recommend to start with a simpler improvement - just make the error message clearly say that the fix is to specify name in apply().

However, if you're willing to drive an effort to use application stack traces in more places in Beam, starting with a discussion on the mailing list - that would be a wonderful contribution and I'd be happy to review it.
(bumping grpc version by +5 seems welcome but quite risky, hence the ValidatesRunner tests)
Thank you! While trying to merge this, I noticed a much more serious issue that I believe should be resolved before this one: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3261 - could you take a look?
@jkff I'm aware of that issue as well. It is certainly important, but at the same time it's not new and I don't see why it needs to be resolved in order for this change to be merged.
Thanks! Squashed in the fixup and re-running tests since there looked like a failure that I can't imagine this PR caused.
Fair enough, the current PR is an improvement in any case. Simplified the test a little bit and merged.
After another look, I think that the base of this solution won't improve Python 3 compatibility in the long run. I'll submit a more clean PR later.
Now that we have migrated to gitbox, I can close this. I am going to do so, since it is on the actual target branch of `tez-runner`.
There are conflicts introduced - would you mind rebasing? That would also give more recent signal for our use of the GitHub merge button, for which the Jenkins result gets stale.

Yeah. I included your simple list tests but was unable to figure out a good solution to inferring from builtin callables like list/tuple. My last PR was poorly written and had a too large scope so I tried to focus on the JIRA issue in this case.
@chamikaramj This change looks good to me.  The Jenkins failure seems to be related to a completely different part of the Beam API.  What do we need to do to move this forward?
ok - I’ve got some changes to that one too. How about if we coordinate a bit so we don’t duplicate work like this by accident?
Really excited to see more folks working on Py3 support, so hoping we can all get it done together faster :)
Also if you want to chat my email isholden@pigscanfly.ca :)
Sorry. I should have made sure to coordinate these changes. Glad to help get Beam to Python 3
Done, I had to rebase because I did a mess during the merge so please take a look again.
Waiting for #4170 to be merged with the enabled ValidatesRunner before I can update this one.
Waiting for #4170 to be merged with the enabled tests before rebasing this one and that we can go ahead.

R: @aaltay 
Postsubmit and ValidatesRunner suites are fixed in this PR, performance test failure is unrelated and needs to be addressed separately. Java tests in gradle suite seem to have an unrelated failure, but passed in Maven suite.
What you have done here is great, was wondering if you had time to follow up on the review comments?
Hey Luke, I got 90% done with your latest over the long weekend, should have time to wrap up tomorrow after work, so you should see something Wednesday morning.
It looks like the failed test was a timeout -- mind taking a look at this again?
Looks like Jenkins  is stable now. I'll wait for the current run.
I believe this failure to be related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3261?jql=project%20%3D%20BEAM%20AND%20text%20~%20%22Apex%22
Hm seems the tests don't pass, could you take a look?
OK I found the issue and I'm gonna fix it myself and merge.
Hey @jbonofre, have you had a chance to review this?
Hey @XuMingmin, any updates on this PR?
@robertwb is this ready to be merged?
What is the next action for this PR?
@peihe @kennknowles what is the status of this PR?
Hey @holdenk, sorry I missed the question earlier. Do you still have the issue?
What are the next steps for this PR?

Yes, this is ready to be merged.

wrote:

@aaltay next step is to finish the [previous PR](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4128). After that this one can be rebased and merged as well. 

Probably this PR  can be reviewed independently, it only has 1 commit related to it, other commits are from the previous PR.
@tgroh has reviewed my runner changes previously, sorry for lagging on fixing the pre-commit tests, I've had other priorities to handle.

Jenkins: retest this please

Were there logs missing without these flushes?
@jbonofre maybe a new PR for this? this has too much noise already, and the Pr should be something like "upgrade Spark to Spark 2.1.0" or something, no ?
